questions.question: What is the event-driven programming model in Node.js called?
Which module in Node.js is used for handling file operations?
Which of the following is NOT a core module in Node.js?
What is the purpose of the 'require' function in Node.js?
What is the event loop in Node.js?
options: A mechanism for handling asynchronous operations
A loop that executes JavaScript code
A loop that handles HTTP requests
A mechanism for handling file operations
questions.correctAnswer: A mechanism for handling asynchronous operations

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true about Node.js?
options: It is a single-threaded runtime environment
It is built on the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine
It is only suitable for frontend development
It is highly scalable and efficient
questions.correctAnswer: It is only suitable for frontend development

questions.question: What is the package.json file used for in Node.js projects?
options: To define project metadata and dependencies
questions.correctAnswer: To define project metadata and dependencies

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of using Node.js?
What is a callback function in Node.js?
options: A function passed as an argument to another function
A function that returns a promise
A function that generates random numbers
A function used for defining routes
questions.correctAnswer: A function passed as an argument to another function
